snippet: The chief executive of the Cleveland Clinic, Dr. Delos M. Cosgrove, said Saturday that he had been considered for the job of secretary of veterans affairs, but had withdrawn his name.
abstract: Dr Delos M Cosgrove, chief executive of the Cleveland Clinic, says he had been considered by Pres Obama for the job of secretary of veterans affairs, but has withdrawn his name and will stay at clinic; statement comes as Obama administration searches for a successor to Eric Shinseki to lead troubled Veterans Affairs Dept.
lead_paragraph: The chief executive of the Cleveland Clinic, Dr. Delos M. Cosgrove, said Saturday that he had been considered for the job of secretary of veterans affairs, but had withdrawn his name.

headline.main: Cleveland Clinic Chief Out of Running for V.A.
headline.print_headline: Cleveland Clinic Chief Out of Running for V.A.
